intro: Rhodocolea racemosa var. gerrardiana, commonly known as the serrated rhodocolea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and racemose inflorescence. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale green to yellowish in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly encountered in its natural habitat.
